title: Chas & Dave star diagnosed with cancer of the oesophagus
text: Share this article Share The pair are famed for pioneering the 'rockney' genre with their Cockney pub singalong tunes, music-hall humour and boogie-woogie piano. Chas, real name Charles, and David Peacock, announced that they were set to go their separate ways in 2009 after 40 years of performing together. Determined: The Chas & Dave star, 73, has started immediate treatment to battle the disease after doctors found it in the early stages Short retirement: Chas, real name Charles, and David Peacock (above), announced that they were set to go their separate ways in 2009 after 40 years of performing together following the death of Dave's wife At the time, their agent said that Dave had been very badly affected by the loss of his wife after 36 years of 'blissful marriage'. 'Understandably Dave has taken his loss very badly and he hasn't the heart to continue gigging and with regret he has decided to retire from the music business,' he said. In 2013, they decided to return, with Dave revealing that a year of to grieve had made him realise he didn't want to retire from the stage. He explained: 'I had to have a year off when I lost my wife Sue. I needed to get my thoughts together. But after a year I couldn’t stay away. 'We both like playing too much to retire. Now we know it’ll never ­happen. We’ve been gigging all our lives. This means so much to us.” 'We didn’t get into music to become famous. We got into it ­because we loved performing and we still love it. We can’t stop.'
